III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
House of Love is two story home with a basement located in downtown Saginaw,
MI. The eight-bed facility is located on a corner lot on a main street. This building
underwent significant construction to bring it up to code and make it appropriate
for a Child Caring Institution license. Parking is located in the one lane driveway
next to the house as well as behind the building. There are public parking options
at nearby locations within walking distance as well. The exterior of the building
contains a newly renovated front deck that wraps around the west corner of the
house. Upon entering the front door of the home to the right is a stairwell going
upstairs, and to the left is a living room area. Directly ahead of the front entrance
of the home is a hallway that extends to the back of the home. This hallway
connects a dining area on the left side of the home, private meeting rooms and a
salon area on the right side of the home, a bathroom containing a full shower and
eventually leads to the kitchen area. The private meeting room has a television
and is intended to be utilized for in person and video meetings and visitations.
The living room area has a larger sectional couch and furniture as well as a
television intending for recreational and social use. The dining area has a large
table with eight to 10 chairs as well as a fireplace. To the left of the dining area is
an office area where there is the ability to have locked areas for files and
medications. The kitchen area has a working stove, refrigerator and adequate
2

storage for kitchen items and dry food. In the back of the kitchen is another exit to
the exterior on to a small back porch.
There is a stairway to the left of the kitchen that leads to the upstairs. The
stairway on the opposite side of the house leads upstairs as well. When coming
upstairs from the front stairway of the house there is a small landing at the top of
the stairs. In total there are three bedrooms upstairs and another room designed
to be an office and workspace for the youth. Bedroom one is sized 152.75 square
feet has two beds, bedroom two is sized 217 square feet has four beds and
bedroom three is sized 130 square feet and has two beds. All three bedrooms
contain areas for personal storage for youth, and the building has additional
storage space in the basement as well. All of the beds had proper blankets,
sheets and pillows. There is another full bathroom on the second floor with a full
shower.
The facility has adequate safety features, including door alarms on all exits as well
as windows.
There is a door on the first floor that leads to an unfinished basement. Additional
storage areas are available there. Laundry appliances are located here as well.
There are not any other areas of the basement that will be intended for
programming use, but there are also not any safety concerns present.
An Environmental Health Inspection was approved as of 04/17/2023 resulting in
an “A” rating. A Fire Safety Inspection was approved as of 02/24/2023 with an “A”
rating. The City of Saginaw approved this property to be used in this capacity as
of 06/22/2023. The facility does have working cameras in multiple locations and
these have the ability to record and save video.
B. Program Description
House of Love Agency (HOLA) is a private Child Caring Institution organized to
provide general residential services for abused and neglected children, aiming to
offer nonsecure shelter residential program for females. The age range they will
be serving is 6 to 17 years old. The facility is being licensed for a capacity of eight
youth. This program is intended to serve youth in the abuse/neglect child welfare
system who are in need of temporary, short term shelter placement in order to
avoid less safe living options while work is performed to find more permanent
settings for them. The primary funding sources are private funding, local
donations, state and federal grants as well as a possible contract with the
Michigan Department of Health and Human Services.
HOLA’s programming is for typically 30 days or less, but youth stays may exceed
this timeframe on a case-by-case basis. During that time HOLA has policies &
procedures built around frequent service planning and assessment of needs.
Social Service Workers will complete revised treatment plans with collaboration of
the youth every seven days with mutually agreed upon goals and objectives. The
3

Social Worker or Social Worker Supervisor will assess and monitor youth
educational needs and progress weekly.
HOLA has no plans to engage in any form of physical restraining, and has training
built around the effort to engage and de-escalate youth in order to avoid a
situation where that could be an option in response to a youth’s behavior. Their
policies and procedures clearly state that restraints will be prohibited. All staff will
also be trained in medication passing.
HOLA has committed to following rule requirements for ratio staffing, including at
least one staff being responsible for the supervision and care of four youth at a
time during waking hours and the same ratio during sleeping hours.
Mental health and services will be provided primarily by the local county
Community Mental Health authority, including wraparound, crisis and therapy
support, education programs, job readiness, and Wraparound services. The
agency will be providing various independent living services to youth placed.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The agency was found in compliance.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-month
original license be issued.
